intro: Cnidium tolucense, commonly known as Tolucense hogweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, slender stem and large, umbrella-like compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in complex inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forested areas. Due to its toxic sap, it is considered a potentially dangerous plant to handle.
